tunisian stitches so i use a 0 5 mm smaller hook than i would for simple stitch regular crochet borders are optional i recommend one for the napkin to neaten the edges the tunisian return pass is worked at the end of every row since it is worked the same way every time instructions are given for the forward pass only the return pass does not count as a separate row by convention it is considered the second half of each row do not turn the work ever the forward and return pass are worked with the same side facing you which results in a right and a wrong side to the fabric
